website_summaries.verdict: The X-Mission 3 from Salomon gives runners the grace and power to traverse many types of surfaces with ease. Durable components allow the foot to be protected from any immediate danger, and trail-optimized sections help in performing exceptionally well on unpredictable terrain. Still, it can function on the roads, making trail-to-asphalt transitions quite easy.
pros: Breathable coverage is provided by the 3D Mesh upper
The Sensifit overlay system wraps around the foot in a secure but customizable way
Runners appreciated the inclusion of the Sensiflex stretch panels, which support the foot while also encouraging flexibility
The Quicklace system was welcomed by many runners because it made it easier for them to adjust the tightness and looseness of the fit
Underfoot cushioning is handled well by the plush and durable full-length foam unit
Anti-abrasion rubber with non-prominent gripping lugs make the outsole useful on both the trails and the roads
cons: A few runners noted that the toe area was a bit tight
The ankle collar is too high, which caused cuts to the skin, said a wearer

customer_reviews.title: Great on trails
customer_reviews.text: Well this is s tough one as this shoe has great grip and flexibility for trails but not great energy return. My GT2000 4 have better energy return bon harder surfaces but too stiff for comfortable trail running. It's like I need to be able to swap shoes during s running session which isn't practical. I do give this case 4 as it does seem durable even with my weight and heavy use on trails just wish it had more energy return but that may compromise it's flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: IGM

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many pairs of Salomon footwear, from running shoes to hiking shoes. They are always good quality, and they seem to fit me well, just have to order a half size larger than normal ( 12 instead of 11.5 ) These are comfy, very grippy ( except wet rocks ) and look good enough to go out and about in. Mainly bought for my 4.5 miles walk to work, over a mix of pavement & trails.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, but very narrow fitting.
customer_reviews.text: These are another great pair of Salomon shoes. They seem really good but they are very narrow fitting on the top of the foot. My normal size was too small so I tried a larger size and still too small on the top of my foot. Unfortunately these shoes are not suitable for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mista Craig

customer_reviews.title: comfortable trainers
customer_reviews.text: just got a half size bigger than normal shoes and they fitted very well and are comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: The shoe seemed good quality. Im a size 7.5 ordered 8 as other reviews suggested and way too small so I returned. If you are thinking of buying i advise 1 or even two sizes bigger.
customer_reviews.author: cat

customer_reviews.title: Un property sizes
customer_reviews.text: They look verry nice but the size is smaller, I have 7 UK but their are way to small
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Astonishing comfort
customer_reviews.text: They not only look pretty stylish, grey/green/black, and go with almost anything from gym-ware to casual clothing, I cannot recall putting on a new pair of anything before these that fits so well and seems so made to measure! The grip is good (evidenced by me walking confidently through a potentially hazardous path of shiny wet leaves without slipping) and the laces are unique to me, tightened by a kind of pull-cord, which I have to say, works well as it`s nice to have the pressure of tightness up above the ankle instead of compressing the entire top of the foot. All in all, expensive and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ongo Gablogian

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow fit
customer_reviews.text: Extremely light running shoe with a type of lace I've never seen before, it has a no-knot system of pushing a closing device down towards the shoe, through which the thin and fine laces are threaded. However, it appears to me that the long end would then dangle towards the floor... My partner is a size 9 but unfortunately was unable to actually get the running shoes on as they are far too narrow. They appear to be made to be breathable and would probably be fine for someone with far narrower feet.
customer_reviews.author: Four Violets

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light
customer_reviews.text: As many of the reviews state you should order a shoe slightly larger than what you actually need. go with 1/2 size to 1 full size larger and you will be about right. The arch to the shoe and the way they lace (which is very handy!) makes them fit differently to other shoes. They are beyond comfortable and make you feel like you're walking across styrofoam! I love the design of the shoe, not too fussy and not too plain. On a warm day they also breath really well too.
customer_reviews.author: Contributor77

customer_reviews.title: Can't put them on!
customer_reviews.text: The opening is so small, that unless you have very narrow and generally tiny feet (unlikely for a size 12.5 shoe!) you may struggle to put these on. The fastening system doesn't allow the shoe to open fully, and even if it did, the throat is structured so that it restricts the opening. Had to send them back. Which was a pity, as they otherwise seemed like nice shoes.
customer_reviews.author: RobA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Wore those for a muddy and slippery parkrun this weekend. Performance was brilliant. They are lightweight and have excellent grip and good support. The lace functionality is a little tricky to begin with. I pull it tight but then have to tuck the long loop under the others so that it doesn't flap around. Other than that though, excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Shooooeeeeeeesssssssss
customer_reviews.text: These are really comfy running/walking shoes. Not that good in wet weather, but very good for extended running or walking or skipping or prancercise sessions when the weather is dry. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Manda Moo

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's X-Mission 3 Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Take on the challenge of any surface with ease with the X-MISSION 3 running shoe, which will prepare you for your next adventure. Lightness: The lightweight shoe (350 to 400 g) ensures easy comfort even during long workouts. Quick and Safe Lace Adjustment: The Quicklace system allows you to tighten the laces quickly and easily, without knots. Fit Management: The Sensifit system cradles the foot ideally, offering a secure and snug fit. Sole: The Contagrip Wet Traction sole is made from light, resistant rubber that offers grip and resistance to ensure a safe run on wet surfaces.
feature_bullets: Molded EVA midsole gives you a soft, pillow feel on urban or trail environments.
Since you never know what kind of surface you'll encounter on the trail, the 3D Grip with multi-density, multi-pattern ensures confidence on wet or dry, hard or soft surfaces.
Sensei with quick lace and sensible provide a snug, comfortable fit for agility in varying terrain.
